title: Vistula
summary: The Vistula (/ˈvɪstjʊlə/; Polish: Wisła, Polish pronunciation: [ˈvʲiswa] (listen), German: Weichsel, Latin: Vistula) is the longest river in Poland and the 9th-longest river in Europe, at 1,047 kilometres (651 miles) in length.[1][2] The drainage basin, reaching into three other nations, covers 193,960 km2 (74,890 sq mi), of which 168,868 km2 (65,200 sq mi) is in Poland.[3]
